name: Security & Identity Management
description: This section focuses on identity and access management (IAM) to control permissions and protect cloud resources, as well as securing cloud instances using security groups and firewall rules.

learning_steps.description:
- Least Privilege Principle - Grant only the minimum permissions needed
- RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) - Assign permissions based on job roles
- Stateful vs Stateless rules - Security groups are stateful, network ACLs are stateless
- Inbound vs Outbound rules - Control traffic in both directions

Complete these security exercises on your cloud platform:

1. Create IAM users and groups with specific permissions
2. Implement IAM roles for secure access management
3. Define and apply IAM policies to restrict access to sensitive resources
4. Create a security group for a VM instance
5. Define inbound rules to allow specific traffic (e.g., HTTP, SSH, RDP)
6. Define outbound rules to control external communication
7. Apply security group rules to a VM and verify access restrictions
8. Test traffic flow by attempting to connect from allowed and restricted IPs
